storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive inline alerts for scheduling conflicts to correct issues immediately

testCases.title: Display inline alert on scheduling conflict
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduler
Scheduling form is accessible and loaded
At least one existing booking is present in the system
Real-time conflict detection API is operational

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling form interface
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling form displays with all required fields (date, time, resource, etc.)

steps.action: Enter scheduling details that conflict with an existing booking (e.g., same resource, overlapping time)
steps.expectedResult: Inline alert appears next to the conflicting field with a clear conflict message indicating the nature of the conflict

steps.action: Verify the visual highlighting of the conflicting field
steps.expectedResult: Conflicting field is visually highlighted (e.g., red border, warning icon) and alert message is displayed inline

steps.action: Modify the scheduling details to resolve the conflict (e.g., change time or resource)
steps.expectedResult: Inline alert disappears automatically as soon as the conflict is resolved

steps.action: Verify the visual highlighting is removed from the previously conflicting field
steps.expectedResult: Field returns to normal state without highlighting or alert message

steps.action: Re-enter conflicting scheduling details
steps.expectedResult: Inline alert reappears next to the conflicting field

steps.action: Attempt to submit the form with the unresolved conflict by clicking the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Form submission is blocked and an alert message is displayed indicating that conflicts must be resolved before submission

steps.action: Resolve the conflict by modifying the scheduling details
steps.expectedResult: Alert disappears and Submit button becomes enabled

steps.action: Submit the corrected schedule
steps.expectedResult: Form submits successfully and confirmation message is displayed

postconditions: Schedule is saved without conflicts
No inline alerts are displayed on the form
User remains on the scheduling interface or is redirected to confirmation page

testCases.title: Verify alert display latency under 500ms
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduler
Scheduling form is loaded and ready for input
Performance monitoring tools are available to measure latency
Conflict detection API is responding normally
At least one existing booking is present in the system

steps.action: Open browser developer tools and navigate to the Network or Performance tab
steps.expectedResult: Developer tools are open and ready to monitor performance metrics

steps.action: Start performance recording or timestamp tracking
steps.expectedResult: Performance monitoring is active

steps.action: Trigger a scheduling conflict by entering conflicting data (e.g., overlapping time slot with existing booking)
steps.expectedResult: Inline alert is displayed next to the conflicting field within 500 milliseconds of data entry

steps.action: Review the performance metrics or network timeline to verify alert display latency
steps.expectedResult: Latency measurement shows alert displayed in less than 500ms from conflict detection

steps.action: Resolve the conflict by modifying the scheduling details to non-conflicting values
steps.expectedResult: Alert is removed promptly from the interface

steps.action: Verify the alert removal latency
steps.expectedResult: Alert disappears within acceptable time frame (ideally under 500ms)

steps.action: Submit the corrected schedule by clicking the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Form submission succeeds and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Verify the schedule is saved in the system
steps.expectedResult: Schedule appears in the system with correct details and no conflicts

postconditions: Performance metrics confirm alert latency is under 500ms
Schedule is successfully saved without conflicts
System performance meets defined SLA requirements

testCases.title: Ensure alerts prevent form submission until resolved
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduler
Scheduling form is accessible and loaded
At least one existing booking is present that can create a conflict
Form validation is enabled and functioning

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling form
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling form is displayed with all input fields and Submit button enabled

steps.action: Enter conflicting schedule data (e.g., same resource and overlapping time as existing booking)
steps.expectedResult: Inline alert is displayed next to the conflicting field and Submit button is disabled or visually indicates submission is not allowed

steps.action: Verify the alert message content
steps.expectedResult: Alert message clearly describes the conflict and provides guidance on resolution

steps.action: Attempt to submit the form by clicking the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Form submission is blocked and an error message is displayed stating that conflicts must be resolved before submission

steps.action: Verify that no data is sent to the backend
steps.expectedResult: No API call is made to save the conflicting schedule (verify in Network tab)

steps.action: Attempt to submit the form using keyboard shortcut (e.g., Enter key)
steps.expectedResult: Form submission is still blocked with the same error message

steps.action: Resolve the conflict by modifying the scheduling details to non-conflicting values
steps.expectedResult: Inline alert disappears and Submit button becomes enabled

steps.action: Submit the corrected schedule by clicking the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Form submission is accepted and schedule is saved successfully

steps.action: Verify confirmation message is displayed
steps.expectedResult: Success message confirms the schedule has been saved

postconditions: Schedule is saved only after conflict resolution
No conflicting schedules exist in the system
Form validation successfully prevented invalid submission

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive email notifications for scheduling conflicts to stay informed when not actively scheduling

testCases.title: Verify email notification sent upon conflict detection
preconditions: User is registered as a Scheduler with valid email address
Email notification feature is enabled in system configuration
User has email notifications enabled in their preferences
Email server is configured and operational
SMTP settings are correctly configured
At least one existing booking is present in the system

steps.action: Log in to the system as a Scheduler or Administrator
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully logged in and has access to scheduling functionality

steps.action: Trigger a scheduling conflict in the system by creating or modifying a booking that conflicts with an existing one
steps.expectedResult: Conflict is detected by the system and email notification is generated and queued for sending

steps.action: Wait for email processing (up to 30 seconds)
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is sent to the affected scheduler's registered email address

steps.action: Check the recipient's email inbox (or test email account)
steps.expectedResult: Email is received with subject line indicating scheduling conflict

steps.action: Open and review the email content
steps.expectedResult: Email contains correct conflict details including date, time, resource, conflicting bookings, and suggested next steps

steps.action: Verify the email formatting and readability
steps.expectedResult: Email is properly formatted with clear sections, readable fonts, and professional appearance

steps.action: Navigate to the system's email delivery logs or notification history
steps.expectedResult: Email delivery log is accessible and displays recent notifications

steps.action: Verify the email delivery status is logged in the system
steps.expectedResult: Delivery status is recorded as 'Sent' or 'Delivered' with timestamp within 30 seconds of conflict detection

steps.action: Check for any error logs related to email delivery
steps.expectedResult: No errors are present in the email delivery logs

postconditions: Email notification is successfully delivered to scheduler
Email delivery is logged with successful status
Scheduler is informed of the conflict and can take action
System maintains audit trail of notification

testCases.title: Test user notification preference settings
preconditions: User is registered as a Scheduler with valid email address
User account has access to notification preference settings
Email notification system is operational
User is logged into the system

steps.action: Navigate to user profile or settings page
steps.expectedResult: User settings page is displayed with notification preferences section

steps.action: Locate the email notification preferences for scheduling conflicts
steps.expectedResult: Email notification toggle or checkbox is visible and currently enabled

steps.action: Disable email notifications by unchecking the option or toggling it off
steps.expectedResult: Notification preference is updated and visual indicator shows notifications are disabled

steps.action: Save the preference settings by clicking Save or Apply button
steps.expectedResult: Preference is saved successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Verify the preference is persisted by refreshing the page or logging out and back in
steps.expectedResult: Email notification setting remains disabled after page refresh or re-login

steps.action: Trigger a conflict notification by creating a scheduling conflict
steps.expectedResult: Conflict is detected by the system but no email is queued for this user

steps.action: Wait for 30 seconds and check the user's email inbox
steps.expectedResult: No email notification is sent to the user

steps.action: Verify in the system logs that email was not sent due to user preference
steps.expectedResult: System logs show notification was suppressed based on user preference settings

steps.action: Navigate back to notification preferences
steps.expectedResult: Notification preferences page is displayed

steps.action: Enable email notifications by checking the option or toggling it on
steps.expectedResult: Notification preference is updated and visual indicator shows notifications are enabled

steps.action: Save the preference settings
steps.expectedResult: Preference is saved successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Trigger another conflict notification
steps.expectedResult: Conflict is detected and email notification is generated and sent

steps.action: Check the user's email inbox
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is received confirming that email notifications have resumed

postconditions: User notification preferences are correctly saved and applied
Email notifications respect user preference settings
System correctly handles both enabled and disabled notification states
User has control over their notification settings

testCases.title: Ensure email delivery within 30 seconds
preconditions: User is registered as a Scheduler with valid email address
Email notifications are enabled for the user
Email server is operational and responsive
System time is synchronized and accurate
Monitoring tools are available to track email delivery timing
At least one existing booking is present in the system

steps.action: Prepare timing measurement tools (system logs, email server logs, or monitoring dashboard)
steps.expectedResult: Timing measurement tools are ready and synchronized with system time

steps.action: Note the current timestamp before triggering the conflict
steps.expectedResult: Baseline timestamp is recorded for comparison

steps.action: Trigger conflict detection by creating or modifying a booking that conflicts with an existing one
steps.expectedResult: Conflict is detected by the system and timestamp of detection is logged

steps.action: Monitor the email notification queue and processing
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is queued immediately upon conflict detection

steps.action: Track the time from conflict detection to email send initiation
steps.expectedResult: Email is sent within 30 seconds of conflict detection

steps.action: Monitor email server logs for send confirmation
steps.expectedResult: Email server logs show successful send operation with timestamp

steps.action: Review email server logs for any delays or failures
steps.expectedResult: No delays, errors, or failures are recorded in the email server logs

steps.action: Calculate the total time elapsed from conflict detection to email send completion
steps.expectedResult: Total elapsed time is 30 seconds or less

steps.action: Confirm the user receives the email promptly by checking the inbox
steps.expectedResult: Email arrives in the user's inbox within the 30-second SLA window

steps.action: Verify the email timestamp matches the expected delivery time
steps.expectedResult: Email received timestamp is within 30 seconds of conflict detection time

steps.action: Review system performance metrics and notification logs
steps.expectedResult: All performance metrics confirm email delivery met the 30-second SLA requirement

postconditions: Email is delivered within the 30-second SLA
No performance issues or delays are recorded
System meets defined performance requirements
Email delivery timing is logged and verifiable

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want a dashboard widget summarizing current scheduling conflicts to monitor issues at a glance

testCases.title: Verify dashboard widget displays active conflicts
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
At least 5 active scheduling conflicts exist in the system
Conflicts have different resources, times, and statuses
User has permission to access the dashboard
Dashboard page is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to the dashboard page by clicking on 'Dashboard' in the main navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard page loads successfully and the scheduling conflicts widget is visible on the page

steps.action: Locate the scheduling conflicts widget on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Widget displays a count of active conflicts (e.g., '5 Active Conflicts') at the top of the widget

steps.action: Review the list of conflicts displayed in the widget
steps.expectedResult: Widget shows a list of conflicts with columns for resource name, time/date, and status for each conflict

steps.action: Click on the filter dropdown and select a specific resource from the available options
steps.expectedResult: Widget updates the list to display only conflicts associated with the selected resource, and the conflict count updates accordingly

steps.action: Clear the resource filter by clicking 'Clear Filter' or selecting 'All Resources'
steps.expectedResult: Widget returns to displaying all active conflicts with the original count restored

steps.action: Click on the 'Time' column header to sort conflicts by time
steps.expectedResult: Conflicts are reordered in ascending chronological order (earliest time first)

steps.action: Click on the 'Time' column header again to reverse the sort order
steps.expectedResult: Conflicts are reordered in descending chronological order (latest time first)

steps.action: Click on the 'Status' column header to sort conflicts by status
steps.expectedResult: Conflicts are reordered alphabetically by status (e.g., Active, Pending, Unresolved)

postconditions: Dashboard widget displays filtered and sorted conflicts correctly
Widget remains functional for further interactions
No errors are displayed on the page
User remains on the dashboard page

testCases.title: Test widget data refresh every 30 seconds
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Dashboard page is loaded with the conflicts widget visible
At least 3 active conflicts exist in the system
System clock is synchronized for accurate timing
User has ability to create new conflicts for testing

steps.action: Note the current time and the number of conflicts displayed in the widget (e.g., '3 Active Conflicts')
steps.expectedResult: Widget shows the initial count and list of conflicts with a timestamp or last updated indicator

steps.action: Observe the widget without any interaction for 30 seconds using a timer
steps.expectedResult: After 30 seconds, the widget automatically refreshes and displays updated data (refresh indicator may briefly appear)

steps.action: Record the time taken for the refresh to complete from initiation to display of updated data
steps.expectedResult: Refresh completes within 2 seconds, and the widget displays the same or updated conflict data

steps.action: Open a new browser tab or use a separate session to create a new scheduling conflict in the system
steps.expectedResult: New conflict is successfully created and saved in the system

steps.action: Return to the dashboard tab and wait for the next automatic refresh cycle (up to 30 seconds)
steps.expectedResult: Widget automatically refreshes and the conflict count increases by 1 (e.g., from '3 Active Conflicts' to '4 Active Conflicts')

steps.action: Verify the newly created conflict appears in the widget list with correct resource, time, and status details
steps.expectedResult: New conflict is visible in the list with accurate information matching the created conflict

steps.action: Measure the refresh latency by noting the time from refresh initiation to completion
steps.expectedResult: Refresh latency is under 2 seconds as indicated by the loading indicator duration or timestamp comparison

steps.action: Continue observing for one more refresh cycle (30 seconds) to confirm consistent refresh behavior
steps.expectedResult: Widget refreshes again after 30 seconds with latency under 2 seconds, maintaining data accuracy

postconditions: Widget continues to refresh every 30 seconds automatically
All conflicts including newly created ones are displayed accurately
Refresh latency remains under 2 seconds
No performance degradation is observed
User remains on the dashboard page

testCases.title: Ensure navigation from widget to conflict details
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Dashboard page is loaded with conflicts widget visible
At least 2 active conflicts exist in the widget list
Each conflict has complete details (resource, time, status)
Conflict detail pages are accessible and functional

steps.action: Identify a specific conflict in the widget list and note its details (resource name, time, and status)
steps.expectedResult: Conflict is clearly visible with all details displayed in the widget list

steps.action: Click on the selected conflict row or conflict link in the widget list
steps.expectedResult: Browser navigates to the conflict detail page, and the page loads successfully

steps.action: Verify the conflict detail page displays the header with the conflict identifier or title
steps.expectedResult: Page header shows the correct conflict identifier matching the selected conflict

steps.action: Review the conflict details section to verify resource name matches the widget display
steps.expectedResult: Resource name on the detail page matches exactly with the resource shown in the widget

steps.action: Verify the time/date information displayed on the conflict detail page
steps.expectedResult: Time and date information matches the time shown in the widget for this conflict

steps.action: Verify the status information displayed on the conflict detail page
steps.expectedResult: Status on the detail page matches the status shown in the widget (e.g., Active, Pending)

steps.action: Check for additional conflict details that may not be visible in the widget summary
steps.expectedResult: Detail page shows comprehensive information including description, affected parties, and resolution options

steps.action: Click the browser back button or click 'Return to Dashboard' link/button
steps.expectedResult: Browser navigates back to the dashboard page successfully

steps.action: Verify the dashboard page loads completely with all widgets visible
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays correctly with the conflicts widget showing the same list of conflicts as before

steps.action: Verify the conflicts widget maintains any previously applied filters or sort orders
steps.expectedResult: Widget displays conflicts in the same filtered/sorted state as before navigation, maintaining user preferences

postconditions: User is back on the dashboard page
Conflicts widget displays correctly with accurate data
Navigation history is preserved for back/forward browser actions
No errors or broken links are encountered
Widget functionality remains intact for further interactions
